adjective.description: Of or designating the former family Ostracea (now called Ostreidae) of bivalve molluscs, containing the oysters; relating to oysters.

noun.description: A mollusc of the former family Ostracea; an oyster.

origin: Mid 19th century; earliest use found in Todd's Cyclopaedia of Anatomy and Physiology. From scientific Latin Ostracea, former family name (E. A. Crouch Introd. Lamarck's Conchol 20; from French ostracé from ancient Greek ὄστρακον shell of a mussel, oyster, etc.: see ostracon; compare -acea) + -an.
